poem:
The Stage and the Pain

In the penned dark she lay,
medicine chasing a wayward sun,
half the world alight, the other
shadowed by the weight of comedy.

Upright, she crafts mirth
from marrow, the soul's ache;
we laugh, unaware of her
silent duel, each giggle 
a victory against unseen darkness.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. She was experiencing an intense migraine, one of the symptoms of her chronic pain condition fibromyalgia, which affects an estimated one in 20 people, mostly women. All".
